subject: Sales
title: Status and Identity
description: A 60-second lesson on Status and Identity.

hook.text: Nobody needs a $5,000 watch to tell time. Yet Rolex sells billions every single year.

buildup.text: We buy things that signal who we are or who we want to become. Every purchase is a statement.

discovery.text: Apple's iPod wasn't sold on storage. It was sold as identity. Cool people had white earbuds.

twist.text: Even bargain shopping is a status play. Choosing store-brand says 'I'm smart with money.'

climax.text: Every product sits on an identity map. Great sellers know which self-image they're selling.

punchline.text: We don't buy products. We buy who we want to be.

quiz.question: Why did Apple market the iPod with white earbuds?
